qas.question: Who was the German inventor who wrote in 1903 about conductors being laminated in layers to a board?
What material did Thomas Edison experiment with by trying to chemically attach conductors to it?
What year did Arthur Berry patent his print-and-etch method?
In Max Schoop's method, what was used to create the flame-sprayed pattern on the board?
Who obtained a patent in 1927 for his method of electroplating circuit patterns?
development of the methods used in ancient printed circuit boards started when?

plausible_answers.text: flat foil conductors laminated to an insulating board, in multiple layers

qas.question: Thomas Edison patented a print-and-etch method in what year?

plausible_answers.text: flame-spray metal onto a board through a patterned mask

qas.question: In Germany Max Schoop obtained a patent to do what?

context: Development of the methods used in modern printed circuit boards started early <b5_0>in the 20th century<b5_0/>. In 1903, a German inventor, <a0_0>Albert Hanson<a0_0/>, described <b6_0>flat foil conductors laminated to an insulating board, in multiple layers<b6_0/>. Thomas Edison experimented with chemical methods of plating conductors onto <a1_0>linen paper<a1_0/> in 1904. Arthur Berry in <a2_0><b8_0>1913<b8_0/><a2_0/> patented <b7_0>a print-and-etch method<b7_0/> in Britain, and in the United States Max Schoop obtained a patent to <b9_0>flame-spray metal onto a board through <a3_0>a patterned mask<b9_0/><a3_0/>. <a4_0>Charles Ducas<a4_0/> in 1927 patented a method of electroplating circuit patterns.
